page.title: 12Halewood - Church and School
page.content: The churches have maintained schools in Halewood from the 1840's to today. The Church of England School on Church Road, founded in 1841, provides primary education for about 240 children. The Church of England also has close links with most of the county schools in Halewood, the ministers taking assemblies on a regular basis. The Roman Catholic Church maintains one primary school and one secondary school in our area. The secondary school, St Pauls, is due to close in the near future. Many people in Halewood hope to keep the school open as an ecumenical comprehensive school. There has already been a recent Catholic primary school closure. All the churches have Sunday schools attached but attendance in 1985 is far less than in the past.
